title: ‘Lampedusa’ Review: Spotting the Leopard
text: Giuseppe Tomasi, Prince of Lampedusa and Duke of Palma, had two more titles than anyone needs, and, for the first 58 years of his life, too much time—numbingly vast stretches of largely undistinguished, unencumbered years in a Sicily that was always, in his words, “hankering for voluptuous immobility.” When some lock in him finally turned around 1955, he began work on one of the most magisterial and delicate works of 20th-century fiction, racing to complete and publish it before death overtook him in 1957. (He died at age 60 three weeks after his manuscript was rejected for the second time by a publisher.) Published...
description: A historical novel about the Sicilian prince who wrote a superb work of ﬁction about the birth of Italy.
